poem:
The Last Moment  

In beds where whispers  
turn to tender echoes,  
you matter—each breath  
a delicate verse.  

Life cradles softly,  
even as days wane.  
In the grace of sunsets,  
find the warmth of being  
in rooms that listen  
to the quiet heartbeats—  
where tenderness remains  
until the last embrace.
